featuredResources.title: 8 Data Structures That Power Your Databases
featuredResources.description: Learn about 8 data structures that power your databases with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: An exceptional deep dive into the fundamental data structures powering databases. Essential for understanding performance, indexing, and storage. Highly educational and practical.

featuredResources.title: 7 Must-Know Strategies to Scale Your Database
featuredResources.description: Learn about 7 must-know strategies to scale your database with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: Offers highly actionable and critical strategies for scaling databases, covering a range of essential techniques. Extremely practical and well-explained with visuals.

featuredResources.title: How to Design Google Docs
featuredResources.description: Learn about how to design google docs with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: An outstanding and visually rich deep dive into designing Google Docs, covering complex topics like real-time collaboration and conflict resolution. It's a gold standard for case studies and interview preparation.

featuredResources.title: Design Google Maps
featuredResources.description: Learn about design google maps with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: An exceptional and visually comprehensive article on designing Google Maps. It tackles complex geospatial data, routing, and real-time updates, making it an excellent resource for advanced system design.

featuredResources.title: HTTPS, SSL Handshake, and Data Encryption Explained
featuredResources.description: Learn about https, ssl handshake, and data encryption explained with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: An exceptionally clear, comprehensive, and visually rich explanation of HTTPS, SSL handshake, and data encryption, demystifying a complex, critical topic.
keyLearnings: Symmetric vs asymmetric encryption in HTTPS

featuredResources.title: How YouTube Handles Massive Video Uploads
featuredResources.description: Learn about how youtube handles massive video uploads with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: An outstanding case study on designing a large-scale video upload and processing system like YouTube. Provides deep insights into distributed storage, encoding, and CDN, highly educational.

featuredResources.title: How Netflix Scales Push Messaging
featuredResources.description: Learn about how netflix scales push messaging with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: A deep dive into Netflix's specific challenges and solutions for scaling push messaging to massive user bases. Offers advanced insights into high-throughput, distributed messaging systems.

featuredResources.title: Netflix's Overall Architecture
featuredResources.description: Learn about netflix's overall architecture with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: An excellent high-level overview of Netflix's overall architecture, covering microservices, CDNs, data pipelines, and recommendation engines. Essential for understanding large-scale cloud-native systems.

featuredResources.title: Evolution of the Netflix API Architecture
featuredResources.description: Learn about evolution of the netflix api architecture with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: A highly insightful look into the evolution of Netflix's API architecture, from initial design to scaling for diverse clients and massive traffic. Crucial for advanced API design and microservice integration.

featuredResources.title: Twitter Architecture 2022 vs. 2012
featuredResources.description: Learn about twitter architecture 2022 vs. 2012 with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: An exceptional comparison showcasing the architectural transformation of Twitter over a decade. Provides profound insights into scaling challenges, tech debt, and modernizing a massive real-time system.

featuredResources.title: Evolution of Uber's API Layer
featuredResources.description: Learn about evolution of uber's api layer with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: Detailed analysis of Uber's API layer evolution, focusing on challenges related to geo-spatial data and real-time updates. Invaluable for designing APIs for complex, distributed, and real-time services.

featuredResources.title: Study guide
featuredResources.description: What you are asked in an interview depends on variables such as:
featuredResources.reasoning: Provides a clear and comprehensive study guide, organizing various system design topics effectively. The presence of visuals enhances the learning path, making it highly practical for structuring study.

featuredResources.title: System design interview questions with solutions
featuredResources.description: [View exercise and solution](solutions/system_design/pastebin/README.md)
featuredResources.reasoning: This resource provides practical examples of system design interview questions with well-explained solutions. The inclusion of visuals is a significant plus, making complex solutions easier to grasp and apply.

featuredResources.title: Appendix
featuredResources.description: You'll sometimes be asked to do 'back-of-the-envelope' estimates.  For example, you might need to determine how long it will take to generate 100 image thumbnails from disk or how much memory a data structure will take.  The **Powers of two table** and **Latency numbers every programmer should know** are handy references.
featuredResources.reasoning: Excellent resource for 'back-of-the-envelope' estimations, a critical skill for system designers. The content is clear, practical, and the presence of visuals (implied for calculations) significantly aids understanding and application.

featuredResources.title: What makes HTTP2 faster than HTTP1?
featuredResources.description: Learn about what makes http2 faster than http1? with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: Excellent explanation of HTTP/2's performance advantages over HTTP/1, using effective visuals to illustrate complex concepts like multiplexing and server push.

featuredResources.description: Learn about how does a typical push notification system work? with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: Clearly explains the architecture and flow of a typical push notification system, including client-side, server-side, and platform services. Highly practical given the ubiquity of push notifications.

featuredResources.title: Netflix Tech Stack - Databases
featuredResources.description: Learn about netflix tech stack - databases with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: Provides excellent insights into Netflix's diverse database choices and their specific use cases. Demonstrates polyglot persistence and the rationale behind selecting different database types for a large-scale system.

featuredResources.title: Evolution of Airbnb’s Microservice Architecture
featuredResources.description: Learn about evolution of airbnb’s microservice architecture with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: Details the evolution of Airbnb's architecture from monolith to microservices, providing valuable lessons on motivations, challenges, and patterns involved in such a transition. Highly applicable for architectural planning.

featuredResources.description: Learn about types of message queues with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: Clearly explains different types of message queues, their patterns (pub/sub, point-to-point), and common implementations. Fundamental knowledge for building robust and scalable distributed systems.

featuredResources.title: Database Isolation Levels
featuredResources.description: Learn about database isolation levels with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: Excellent visual explanation of fundamental database isolation levels, crucial for understanding transactional behavior and concurrency. Highly practical for database design.

featuredResources.description: Learn about how to decide which type of database to use with visual explanations from ByteByteGo.
featuredResources.reasoning: Provides a practical framework and considerations for choosing the right database type based on use cases and requirements. Strong visual guidance.
